page.title: 16A WALK OVER DUFTON'S FELLS
page.content: One summer morning we set off by land- rover to the highest point of our area.We viewed & photographed the mine-workings,then walked southwards passing the old mine shafts & levels. The grass springy & wet beneath our feet,the air clear & fresh,the view extensive.We joined an old miners' track down the hillside, & picnicked on a thyme-covered bank,followed the fell wall,a rocky limestone cliff & open pasture to our left,the enclosed pastureland to our right.We admired a steep valley choked with boulders.We listened for the stream hidden deep beneath them and marvelled at the bright patches of yellow stonecrop. The sheep were newly marked in their owners' patterns of red & blue.Later we descended a steep grassy slope & watched 2 men repairing a gap in the stone wall on our way home.
